alert.note: Alert for Musselshell; Northeastern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 3:16PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Musselshell and north central Yellowstone Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 314 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles south of Melstone, or 29 miles east of Roundup, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail with heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Musselshell and north central Yellowstone Counties. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
